103.sentence_2: You can use the constellation of Cassiopeia, the sitting queen who resembles a "W," which is an equal distance from the North Star <as the Big Dipper>.
103.context_before:
* Find the back of the "Plough blade." This is the outermost part of the dipper, which is the furthest away from the handle of the spoon. 
 * Move four blade lengths along from the back of the blade to find the North Star.
103.context_after: The position of this star never changes.    * Use the sight line that's on top of the aiming beam to align the beam and the North Star.     * Take a protractor and measure the angle between the beam and the horizon, which should measure 90º to the plumb line. This is your latitude.

104.sentence_1: To be safest, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
104.sentence_2: To be safest <as you pack>, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
104.context_before: At the very least, aim to drink 16oz or more of water in the hour leading up to your swim. Stuff phones, electronics, and valuables in resealable plastic bags.
104.context_after: If you are taking things like your mobile phone that can't get wet, take them in a separate small bag, pockets of your clothes or a waterproof bag which you can put in your swimming bag.

105.sentence_1: A cruise is a good option, as they usually include your accommodations, food, and travel in one set price.
105.sentence_2: A cruise is a good option <if you want an easy vacation>, as they usually include your accommodations, food, and travel in one set price.
105.context_before: 4. Do a cruise if you have a tight budget. You may opt to get around Europe by booking a cruise where you visit several cities or destinations.
105.context_after: * Look for cruises in Europe online. Check for cruises that fit your budget and your travel dates.   5. Decide if you are staying in a hotel, a homestay, or a hostel. Pick your accommodations based on your budget.

106.sentence_1: Avoid hiding these items in areas such as your shoes, as while it may be inconspicuous at first, it draws greater attention when you need to access them, making you an easier target for mugging.
106.sentence_2: Avoid hiding these items in areas such as your shoes, as while it may be inconspicuous at first, it draws greater attention when you need to access them, making you an easier target for mugging, <especially if you are alone>.
106.context_before:
Carry your passport, along with your credit cards, with you at all times. Keep them in a secure location, such as in a bag that you carry at the front of your body, and do not remove them unless absolutely necessary. 
 *
106.context_after: * Make photocopies of your passport and keep them in your luggage or a separate place from your original passport. This can make replacing a lost passport somewhat easier.   2. Try to blend in on the streets. Travelers who come to Paris wearing Hawaiian shirts and baseball caps stick out to petty thieves.

107.sentence_2: Compare methods of travel <ahead of time>.
107.context_before:
It would be a huge undertaking to learn the language of each country you want to visit when you travel the world, but you can make traveling easier by memorizing a few key phrases in each country's language to help you communicate with the locals and get around. Learn how to greet and thank someone, how to agree and disagree, how to ask how much something is and where a place is located. 
 5.
107.context_after: * You have the option of traveling by ship, train or airplane and all of these will have multicountry ticket plans. Price out around-the-world ticket packages for the countries you want to visit so you can choose the most economical form of travel.   6. Pack light.
